video.title: MASTER your coding interview
video.description:
Learn tips and strategies for mastering technical whiteboard coding interviews. You will see how to solve many common interview problems and understand the concepts behind the solutions.

Coding interviews aren't all about how good you are at software engineering.
They're about how well you play the coding interview game. This video will help you beat the game.

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:01:04) Median of Arrays
⌨️ (0:36:19) Missing Two Numbers
⌨️ (1:08:10) 0-1 Knapsack
⌨️ (1:38:37) Integer to Roman Numeral
⌨️ (1:55:59) Matrix Product
⌨️ (2:29:36) Autocomplete
⌨️ (3:01:14) Build Order
⌨️ (3:28:11) Find All Duplicates
⌨️ (3:46:45) Priority Queue
⌨️ (4:17:34) List Cycles

⭐️ Problems Descriptions and Code ⭐️
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/median/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/twomissingnumbers/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/01knapsack/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/inttoroman/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/matrixproduct/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/autocomplete/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/buildorder/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/findduplicates/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/priorityqueue/
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/listcycles/

📄 PDF download with 51 interview questions:
https://www.byte-by-byte.com/50-questions/

🎥 Course from Sam Gavis-Hughson of byte-by-byte.com. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWSYAntBbdd2SLYUqPIxo0w

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

And subscribe for new videos on technology: https://youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=freecodecamp

topLevelComment.author: Panda
topLevelComment.text: 1:07:34 The example works because you know how the input array was sorted for you to implement the pivot (ie. left side of pivot is smaller than pivot and right side is larger). The original problem did not stated the input array is sorted nor did it state how the input array is sorted. In general, you would be running your loop in ascending order and ended up working with a descending order sorted input array (or not sorted at all). The implemented pivot method would fail. Therefore, wouldn't the Big O analysis has to be O(nlogn) to account for sorting the input array first for you to know how the input array was sorted?

topLevelComment.author: penciltwirler
topLevelComment.text:
For the two missing integer problem, there is an elegant math solution.
We can do  A =  sum(1, ... , N) - sum(arr) like before, but then compute B = sum(1^2, ... ,N^2) - sum(x^2 for x in arr). Let (x, y) be the solution. Then it stands to reason that A = x + y, and B = x^2 + y^2. We have two equations and 2 unknowns, so we can eventually get to a closed form equation and use the quadratic formula to compute x and y. I'll leave it to the reader to figure that out :)

replies.author: penciltwirler
replies.text: Math is more powerful than CS ;)

replies.author: Igbo Man
replies.text:
Logic behind xor is this 1 or 0 = 1; 0 or 1 = 1;  1 or 1 = 0.

Now  so 3 in binary is 011... 011 xor 011 is 000

replies.author: dhruva12
replies.text:
if you look the code around, the method says - subarray ie a portion of main array so he says in that context that for that subarray, i will be 1st pointer/index = location/position  while j will be the last pointer/index = location/poisition

While, C pointers are the memory location inside its runtime engine/box

topLevelComment.author: Gary Lau
topLevelComment.text: Is it worth to quit my job and spend 9 months to prepare for the Google interview?

replies.author: Byte by Byte
replies.text: @Quincy Larson Just came here to say exactly this ^. That article has a lot of good stuff, but you can also see how studying full time definitely doesn't guarantee you the job

replies.author: Quincy Larson
replies.text: I don't recommend quitting your job. Instead I recommend taking a steady pace and preparing over a longer period of time. This is more effective than cramming, and you will be less likely to burn out or run out of money. There are tons of great resources to prepare for the job interview that are free and self paced. Start with this article: https://medium.freecodecamp.org/why-i-studied-full-time-for-8-months-for-a-google-interview-cc662ce9bb13

topLevelComment.author: Byte by Byte
topLevelComment.text:
Hey everyone! Sam here :)


As I mentioned in the video, I help software engineers prepare for coding interviews. I have a lot more content like this over on my channel (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWSYAntBbdd2SLYUqPIxo0w ) and we've published a couple cool new posts recently on our blog as well (recursion: https://www.byte-by-byte.com/recursion, strings: https://www.byte-by-byte.com/strings ). 


I'll try and keep an eye on the comments here if you have any questions!
